citation.article-title: Fermentation of glutamate and other compounds by Acidaminobacter hydrogenoformans gen. nov. sp. nov., an obligate anaerobe isolated from black mud. Studies with pure cultures and mixed cultures with sulfate-reducing and methanogenic bacteria.

p.s: Description of Acidaminobacter hydrogenoformans sp. nov.
Acidaminobacter hydrogenoformans hy.dro.ge.no.fo'r.mans. M.L.n. hydrogenium hydrogen, L. adj. formans forming; M.L. adj. hydrogenoformans hydrogenforming)
Rod-shaped cells, 0.5 to 0.6 x 1.5 to 3.7 μm, with pointed ends, single or in pairs.
Glutamate, histidine, cysteine, serine, glycine, adenine, pyruvate and citrate fermented in pure culture.
In mixed cultures with sulfate-reducing bacteria (Desulfovibrio) or methanogenic bacteria (Methanospirillum) several other amino acids and malate utilized as well.
Branched-chain fatty acids formed from branched-chain amino acids.
Propionate in addition to acetate formed from glutamate and histidine.
Lactate, ethanol, succinate, glucose, fructose and aspartate not utilized.
DNA base ratio: 48.1 mol% G+C (thermal denaturation).
Type strain: glu65 (deposited in the Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen, Göttingen, FRG, as DSM 2784).
